page.title: 10TREVELGUE HEAD-CLIFF CASTLE
page.content: Trevelgue Head is the site of an important cliff castle. It was excavated once but not thoroughly.Trevelgue Head was a long headland; now the main part of it is an island. Most of the site is on the island. A bridge links the island to the headland.Trevelgue is about 2 miles long and l mile wide. There are about 26 cliff castles in Cornwall,mainly on the north coast. Trevelgue is one of the best examples of a cliff castle.Today, Trevelgue is hardly recognisable as a cliff castle. It is used for leisure activities, particularly in the summer. Walking,angling, ornithology and golf (only open in the summer) all take place on Trevelgue. Most of the people who use the headland don't know of Trevelgue's history.
